Package net.abi.abisEngine.rendering.shader

Class GLBuffer

java.lang.Object
net.abi.abisEngine.rendering.shader.GLBuffer
Direct Known Subclasses:
GLSLUniformBlockBuffer
public abstract class GLBuffer
extends java.lang.Object
A wrapper class for the GL buffer in memory.
Author:
Abinash Singh

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int bufferID
    The ID of the created UBO in the GL Context.
    static int NULL_BOUND_BUFFER_OBJECT
    A engine specific null FLAG, If the ID variable of a AEGLBuffer is equal to this than it will be considered as non existent in the current GL Context.s
    private int size
    The size in bytes of the entirety of the buffer.
    private int type
    The type of buffer being defined.
    private int usage
    The way that GL should draw this buffer, see glBindBuffer(int, int) for more info.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    GLBuffer​(int type, int usage, int size)
    Creates a new AEGLBuffer class.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    abstract void addData​(java.nio.Buffer buffer)  
    protected void allocate()
    Allocates the buffer with bufferID with supplied parameters in the constructor: GLBuffer(int, int, int).
    void bind()
    Binds the buffer to its ID, if the ID is NULL_BOUND_BUFFER_OBJECT then it returns and does'nt execute GL31.glBindBuffer(int, int) to bind this buffer, without throwing a error.
    int create()
    Creates a Buffer in GL with the specified size in bytes, type and usage.
    protected int genBufferID()
    Generates a empty unallocated GL Buffer object in the GL Context.
    int getBufferID()
    Returns the ID of this defined block after it is created.
    int getSize()
    Returns the defined size of this block in number of bytes
    void setBufferID​(int id)  
    void unbind()
    Simply calls GL31.glBindBuffer(int, int) with a 0 as the buffer index.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • NULL_BOUND_BUFFER_OBJECT

      public static final int NULL_BOUND_BUFFER_OBJECT
      A engine specific null FLAG, If the ID variable of a AEGLBuffer is equal to this than it will be considered as non existent in the current GL Context.s
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • bufferID

      private int bufferID
      The ID of the created UBO in the GL Context. This is defaulted to NULL_BOUND_BUFFER_OBJECT so that the system can recognize that it yet exist in the context.

    • size

      private int size
      The size in bytes of the entirety of the buffer.

    • type

      private int type
      The type of buffer being defined. See glBindBuffer(int, int) for more info.

    • usage

      private int usage
      The way that GL should draw this buffer, see glBindBuffer(int, int) for more info.

  • Constructor Details

    • GLBuffer

      public GLBuffer​(int type, int usage, int size)
      Creates a new AEGLBuffer class.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of buffer to create.
      usage - The usage of this buffer, so GL can optimize memory allocation.
      size - The size of the buffer to create in bytes.

  • Method Details

    • create

      public int create()
      Creates a Buffer in GL with the specified size in bytes, type and usage. After the function completes execution it will un-bind the buffer to NULL_BOUND_BUFFER_OBJECT.
      Returns:
      bufferID of the created buffer.

    • genBufferID

      protected int genBufferID()
      Generates a empty unallocated GL Buffer object in the GL Context. See GL15.glGenBuffers() NOTE: This function returns the current bufferID if this buffer object is not a NULL_BOUND_BUFFER_OBJECT. To recreate this buffer than use #reCreate() or destroy this buffer and create it again.
      Returns:
      bufferID of the generated buffer.

    • allocate

      protected void allocate()
      Allocates the buffer with bufferID with supplied parameters in the constructor: GLBuffer(int, int, int).
      Parameters:
      numBytes -

    • addData

      public abstract void addData​(java.nio.Buffer buffer)

    • bind

      public void bind()
      Binds the buffer to its ID, if the ID is NULL_BOUND_BUFFER_OBJECT then it returns and does'nt execute GL31.glBindBuffer(int, int) to bind this buffer, without throwing a error.

    • unbind

      public void unbind()
      Simply calls GL31.glBindBuffer(int, int) with a 0 as the buffer index.

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Returns the defined size of this block in number of bytes
      Returns:
      size

    • getBufferID

      public int getBufferID()
      Returns the ID of this defined block after it is created. If the block is not yet created then NULL_BOUND_BUFFER_OBJECT is returned by default.
      Returns:
      ID The ID of the buffer or NULL_BOUND_BUFFER_OBJECT

    • setBufferID

      public void setBufferID​(int id)
      Parameters:
      id - the id to set this buffer to.
